dishes.name: Sushi
dishes.description: Sushi is Japan's most famous culinary representative, typically made with rice and fillings which have been rolled inside a sheet of dry seaweed. The term sushi is an umbrella term covering a wide range of subvarieties.

dishes.name: Ramen
dishes.description: Ramen is a noodle soup that first appeared in Japan in 1910, combining Chinese noodles with a salty broth. The noodles are elastic and bright yellow, typically served with pork, chicken, seafood, or vegetables.
ingredients: Pork OR Chicken OR Seafood OR Root Vegetable OR Mushrooms

dishes.name: Sashimi
dishes.description: Sashimi is a Japanese delicacy of thinly sliced raw fish or shellfish served with soy sauce, wasabi, or ginger paste. Common ingredients include tuna, squid, scallop, whale, and octopus.
ingredients: Scallops OR Whale OR Octopus OR Chicken OR Tuna OR Squid

dishes.name: Yakitori
dishes.description: Yakitori refers to skewered grilled chicken, traditionally cooked over a charcoal fire. Different cuts of chicken are used, and it is often served with tare (soy-based sauce) or salt.

dishes.name: Mochi
dishes.description: Mochi are tiny cakes made from glutinous rice, pounded until thick and homogenous. They are an essential part of Japanese cuisine, particularly during cultural events and festivals.

dishes.name: Onigiri
dishes.description: Onigiri are moist, chewy rice balls, often filled with umeboshi (pickled plum) or salmon. They have been a popular Japanese picnic food since the 11th century.

dishes.name: Gyoza
dishes.description: Gyoza are crescent-shaped dumplings, originally from China. They are made with a thin wrapper filled with a mixture of pork, cabbage, chives, and seasoning.

dishes.name: Wagashi
dishes.description: Wagashi are traditional Japanese sweets made from natural plant-based ingredients, often enjoyed with tea. They include a variety of fresh or half-dried confections.

dishes.name: Shabu-shabu
dishes.description: Shabu-shabu is a Japanese hot-pot dish where thinly sliced meat and vegetables are quickly cooked in boiling water. It is traditionally served with dipping sauces.
ingredients: Lobster OR Beef OR Lamb OR Pork OR Chicken OR Duck

dishes.name: Dashi
dishes.description: Dashi is a fundamental ingredient in Japanese cuisine, used as the base for miso soups, noodle soups, and various simmered dishes. It is typically made from kombu (seaweed) and bonito flakes.

dishes.name: Tonkatsu
dishes.description: Tonkatsu is a breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet. It is often served with shredded cabbage and a savory sauce, becoming a favorite comfort food in Japan.

dishes.name: Nigiri
dishes.description: Nigiri, or nigirizushi, is hand-pressed sushi where a slice of seafood is placed on a bed of vinegared rice. The topping may vary, but it often includes salmon, tuna, or eel.
ingredients: Scallops OR Eel OR Octopus OR Salmon

dishes.name: Miso Soup
dishes.description: Miso soup is a traditional Japanese soup made with miso paste and dashi. It is commonly served with tofu, seaweed, and scallions, often as part of breakfast.

dishes.name: Teppanyaki
dishes.description: Teppanyaki is a Japanese grilling technique where ingredients are cooked on a flat iron griddle. Commonly grilled items include beef, seafood, and vegetables.

dishes.name: Karē
dishes.description: Karē, or Japanese curry, is a savory stew-like dish often served with rice. It is influenced by British curry and includes meat, vegetables, and a thick sauce.

dishes.name: Kushiyaki
dishes.description: Kushiyaki refers to skewered and grilled meats, seafood, and vegetables. The ingredients are often seasoned with salt or tare (soy sauce-based glaze).

dishes.name: Yakisoba
dishes.description: Yakisoba is a stir-fried noodle dish typically made with pork, cabbage, and other vegetables. It is a common street food and comfort meal in Japan.

dishes.name: Daifuku
dishes.description: Daifuku is a chewy, sweet Japanese dessert made with mochi and filled with red bean paste, chestnuts, or other fillings.

dishes.name: Teriyaki
dishes.description: Teriyaki is a cooking technique where ingredients are marinated in a soy sauce-based mixture and then grilled or broiled, creating a glossy finish.

dishes.name: Sukiyaki
dishes.description: Sukiyaki is a sweet and salty hot pot dish, typically made with beef, vegetables, and tofu. It is cooked at the table in a shallow iron pan.
